If you will be attending an out of town football game please be mindful that each school has different requirement to buy tickets.

The out of town Varisty games are as follows:

üèàArcher City - Buy tickets online only through their website.

üèàSeymour - Buy tickets at gate but will be required to fill out Covid-19 form before buying ticket. You will need a QR Code reader on your phone.

üèàCity View - Buy tickets online only through their website.

üèàChico - Buy tickets online only through their website.

üèàEra - Buy tickets online only through their website.

The out of town JH/JV games are as follows:

üèàDeLeon - Buy tickets ($4 each) at Windthorst ISD Superintendent's Office, available today, Monday, August 31st through Noon on Thursday, September, 3rd.

üèàHamlin - Buy tickets at gate.

üèàMuenster - Buy tickets at Windthorst ISD Superintendent's Office, available Monday, October 12th through Noon on Thursday, October 15th.

üèàPetrolia - Buy tickets online only through their website.

Note to Parents
If you were on the Free & Reduced Lunch Program last year and have not filled out an application this school year, on September 29, 2020 your child will become a paid student. The prices are $1.50 a day for breakfast and $2.55 per day for lunch. If you need an application, please call or stop by one of the school offices.

With Mrs. Hale being out sick, both drum majors have stepped up and led the band during class and at football games!

Mrs. Hale appreciates all that they do!

post_text:
üèàDue to the Covid-19 situation sports venues around the state and here at Windthorst have been required to limit the attendance to 50 percent of the maximum capacity in the bleachers.

In an effort to make sure you are allowed to attend football games we will be selling season passes for the 5 home varsity football games. The price for the passes will be $25 for the season.

We will sell the tickets at the gate for the normal price of $6 for adult and $4 for students.

We will set back 2 passes, to purchase, for varsity football players, band members, and cheerleaders parents
.
There will be a maximum of 2 passes reserved per family.

This will guarantee parents the opportunity to attend the games if they purchase tickets.

These passes can be purchased in the Superintendent‚Äôs Office prior to the 1st home ball game. They will not be sold at the gate.

The Superintendent's Office hours are 8:00 a.m. - 3:45 p.m., Monday - Friday.

Please call the Superintendent's Office if you have any questions.

Windthorst Independent School District added a new photo.
August 12 at 9:00 AM ¬∑

WISD Staff Spotlight:

Shelby Wolf

Hi, my name is Shelby Wolf. I graduated from Windthorst High School in 2004 and Texas A&M University in 2008. I started teaching in 2012, and I am very excited to be coming home to teach at Windthorst. I have been married to Ross for 10 years, and we have two children. Barrett will be in 3rd grade and Emma will be in 1st grade. In my free time, I enjoy reading, gardening, and watching my kids play sports. I am looking forward to a great year at Windthorst ISD!

post_text:
Bus Routes for the 2020-2021 school year are very similar to last year's routes!

ALL buses will leave the bus barn at 6:30 a.m. every morning. The buses will leave the school at 3:45 p.m. every afternoon.

The WISD Cowboy Church Route will leave the church parking lot at 7:15 a.m. and will return around 4:05 p.m. every afternoon.

Please remember that all students will be required to wear masks and that each bus will sanitized after each route to protect our students' and bus drivers' health.

If you have any questions please contact Dennis Koetter at 940-423-6604 or dennis.koetter@windthorstisd.net

If you have any questions please contact Dennis Koetter at 940-423-6604 or dennis.koetter@windthorstisd.net

post_text:
The parent portal system is now available to complete registration forms for returning students.

The web address has also changed to https://txeis09.txeis.net/ParentPortal/login?distid=005904

After you log in, select your student and click on the red registration button. Then click on the green start registration button.

The first two items will allow you to change phone number, address and other contact information. The remaining forms are some of what we require as part of our registration process.

The student schedules are also visible. Please note that there may be changes to the student schedules prior to the start of school.

post_text:
Graduation 2020 ‚Äì date/time change

Location: WISD football complex

Due to the very strong chance of inclement weather, WHS graduation will be moved to Saturday, May 23rd, at 11AM.

The weather forecast predicts 60-80% chances of rain beginning Sunday and continuing through most of next week. In order to avoid the rain, we are obligated to move the graduation to the above date and time. Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience; we only want to provide the best graduation experience for our students and guests.

If Saturday morning presents us with rain, we will try again at 3pm and 7pm. If these times fail us, we will again attempt our graduation Sunday, May 24th at 3pm. If we are still facing rain, we will try again at 5pm and 7pm. Should the entire weekend be a washout, we will postpose until Saturday, May 30th at 11am.

If the weather is uncooperative Saturday morning, WISD will send out a phone alert to announce any changes. These changes will also be updated on our Facebook page. We cannot express
text:
Graduation 2020 ‚Äì date/time change

Location: WISD football complex

Due to the very strong chance of inclement weather, WHS graduation will be moved to Saturday, May 23rd, at 11AM.

The weather forecast predicts 60-80% chances of rain beginning Sunday and continuing through most of next week. In order to avoid the rain, we are obligated to move the graduation to the above date and time. Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience; we only want to provide the best graduation experience for our students and guests.

If Saturday morning presents us with rain, we will try again at 3pm and 7pm. If these times fail us, we will again attempt our graduation Sunday, May 24th at 3pm. If we are still facing rain, we will try again at 5pm and 7pm. Should the entire weekend be a washout, we will postpose until Saturday, May 30th at 11am.

If the weather is uncooperative Saturday morning, WISD will send out a phone alert to announce any changes. These changes will also be updated on our Facebook page. We cannot express

post_text: Kindergarten and Pre-K registration paperwork needs to be turned in by this Friday, May 22. It is important to get this turned in so we can place students in classes and start getting ready for the 2020-2021 school year. If you did not receive paperwork and would like to enroll your child in Kindergarten or Pre-K, please email or call Diane Herndon (940-423-6679, diane.herndon@windthorstisd.net) and she will get forms mailed to you. We're excited for all of our new students at Windthorst Elementary!!

post_text:
The Kindergarten Class of 2020 will have a "pop-in" graduation on Thursday, May 21, 2020, from 9:00-1:00. The event will be held in front of the elementary school. This will be a quick, pop-in arrival for students to receive their diplomas and gifts. Feel free to take photos. Family members may view this event from their vehicles. Social distancing precautions will be followed.

We regret that we will be unable to provide our students with a formal graduation. However, we are excited to see our students and express how proud we are of them.

Time slots are set at 15 minutes. Please be mindful of your appointment.

Please review the available time slots below and click on the button to sign up. Thank you!

https://www.signupgenius.com/go/9040E4FA9A82DA6FD0-kindergarten
shared_text:
SIGNUPGENIUS.COM
Kindergarten 'Pop-In' Graduation
text:
The Kindergarten Class of 2020 will have a "pop-in" graduation on Thursday, May 21, 2020, from 9:00-1:00. The event will be held in front of the elementary school. This will be a quick, pop-in arrival for students to receive their diplomas and gifts. Feel free to take photos. Family members may view this event from their vehicles. Social distancing precautions will be followed.

We regret that we will be unable to provide our students with a formal graduation. However, we are excited to see our students and express how proud we are of them.

Time slots are set at 15 minutes. Please be mindful of your appointment.

Please review the available time slots below and click on the button to sign up. Thank you!

https://www.signupgenius.com/go/9040E4FA9A82DA6FD0-kindergarten

SIGNUPGENIUS.COM
Kindergarten 'Pop-In' Graduation

Covid-19 isn‚Äôt stopping good things from happening at WISD! Congratulations to Bree & Keaira!!!!

‚ù£Ô∏èWow! Windthorst FCCLA‚Äôs Bree Kirk and Keaira Fillingim‚Äôs scores amounted to first place in the state of Texas! They have the opportunity to compete again at the national conference in Washington DC July 5-9!!! This is the first time Windthorst FCCLA has had a group advance this far! Congratulations on such a huge accomplishment! Due to the unknown circumstances and student safety being utmost importance the FCCLA committee will make a decision by April 22nd if the national conference will still take place, but WOW...... #1 out of all the 1A-6A schools in the entire state is just incredible! Congrats girls!!! ‚ù£Ô∏è

text:
From Coach Cavazos:
I just found out that Rosetta Stone is offering 3 free months of Spanish learning to all students. It is open to students K-12. This would be a good tool for students to practice Spanish or even for parents that want to learn. A lot can be learned in 3 months. Here is the website:

https://www.rosettastone.com/freeforstudents/

ROSETTASTONE.COM
Rosetta Stone for Students

Normally Mrs. Lindley's awards are given and celebrated at school each 9 weeks. This time Mrs. Lindley drove to each student's house and gave them a special treat.

She wished she could have celebrated with hugs and high fives, but it was worth seeing all their smiling faces! üòä

4th Grade Science: Highest Average went to Mattie

post_text:
Governor Abbott just signed an executive order that requires schools to be shut down due to Covid-19 until Monday, May 4, 2020.

WISD staff will continue work with our families to provide quality education for our students. Please remember if you have any questions about work for your students please email your students teachers.

The District will remain in contact with our families and pass on any information we receive through this closure.

We pray that our families and staff will continue to stay healthy during this time.

Lonnie Hise
Superintendent

post_text: Windthorst FCCLA is excited to announce that Keaira Fillingim and Bree Kirk have made the top 5 in the state of Texas! Because the state of Texas competitions were canceled the Texas FCCLA used standard deviation to score all the schools. The top 2 will have a chance at competing at Nationals in Atlanta, Georgia to be held in July. The top two will be announced April 4th. Way to Go Bree and Keaira!!!!!!

post_text:
WISD 5th grader Adam wrote this lovely poem before Spring Break. It really seems to fit with what is going on in our world today! A successful screenwriter saw it and commented on how beautiful it is!

Time

By Adam B.

The clouds are gray, the night is black

Another day I rushed right past.



I want it now, I want it today,

So run, run, run the time away.



But wait, wait, wait,

Look at what I‚Äôm missing on the way

Maybe it‚Äôs not so good to rush instead of stay



From now on I‚Äôll take the time slow

Like a turtle on a stroll



I‚Äôll make sure I don‚Äôt miss one single part

From now on I‚Äôll wait for the very best part.

Dear Windthorst Family,

The 2020 WHS Prom has been postponed from April 4th. I am very sorry to make this announcement, but I see no other options at this time. School is not scheduled to restart until April 6th. Mr. Hise and I made this decision based on the best information available today. We will plan for the Jr. class sponsors to reorganize prom when we have some clarity on current issues.

Thank you for your understanding,

--
Roy Longcrier
Principal
Windthorst Jr. High and High School
940.423.6680

post_text:
A note from Mrs. Hale:

HEY BAND!

I MISS YOU!!!!! No, really, I REALLY DO! Hope you are all enjoying the extra time with your family and staying safe and healthy.

Just wanted to let you know that I have sent assignments via your school email address. I hope you enjoy the assignments. I will be at the band hall next week on Monday and Wednesday 8-12pm so you can drop by and pick up your instruments.

It is very important to come by and at least pick up your mouthpiece and clean it! People around the world are having "musical moments" when they go on their balconies and play their instruments. Maybe Windthorst could use a group "play session" when we all go outside and play in the wind! I wonder if I would hear you from my house? Might be fun!

Anyway - enjoy your family and the work I have assigned. Hope to see everyone soon!

5th Grade: I am still working on a folder for your class. Keep working on your Music Warrior Belts!!

A message from Stacy Wolf:

I want to congratulate all who send their children to Windthorst ISD. I have posted assignments online and the students have been logging onto and completing the assignments. post_text:
Mrs. Buerger‚Äôs First Grade

Hello 1st grade!

I miss you all! I miss your sweet voices reading to me, I miss all the amazing questions you ask, I just miss you! Thank you all for picking up your packets in the office. If you have any questions or concerns, please let me know. You can reach me by the Remind app or at karley.buerger@windthorstisd.net.

See you soon!
Love,
Mrs. Buerger

I attached a little bingo game! As you play to get a bingo, send me some pictures. Either to my e-mail, Remind, I can‚Äôt wait to see your smiles! My heart misses each and every one of you! Can‚Äôt wait to see you!
text:
Mrs. Buerger‚Äôs First Grade

Hello 1st grade!

I miss you all! I miss your sweet voices reading to me, I miss all the amazing questions you ask, I just miss you! Thank you all for picking up your packets in the office. If you have any questions or concerns, please let me know. You can reach me by the Remind app or at karley.buerger@windthorstisd.net.

See you soon!
Love,
Mrs. Buerger

I attached a little bingo game! As you play to get a bingo, send me some pictures. Either to my e-mail, Remind, I can‚Äôt wait to see your smiles! My heart misses each and every one of you! Can‚Äôt wait to see you!

post_text:
A note from Mr. Longcrier:

Windthorst Jr High and High School is contacting every student's parents in order to let them know we are providing educational services during this very strange time.

There will be someone at the Jr High/High School from 9 a.m.-12 p.m. on Thursday (3-19-20) and Friday (3-20-20). You may have to come to the principal's office to find them. The HS front door will be unlocked.

There will be teachers available in both High School and Jr. High from 8 a.m. - 2 p.m. Monday (3-23-20), Tuesday (3-24-20), and Wednesday (3-25-20). If a student needs to ask a question of get some help, it would be best to contact the school at this time.

We apologize for the inconvenience and are very appreciative of your understanding. We are in completely uncharted waters and will continue to do the best we can.

Please contact me if you have any questions or concerns. (roy.longcrier@windthorstisd.net or 940-423-6680)

post_text:
A message for Pre-K parents:

You can keep students learning going by choosing some activities to do daily.

Read books every day! As you read, look for rhyming words, shapes, letters, make predictions about the story, etc. Go outside and talk about the weather. Observe the clouds and moon. Count to 30 while doing an exercise of your choice. Go on a shape walk and see how many triangles, squares, rectangles, circles, ovals, hexagons, trapezoids, and rhombuses you can find. What were there the most and least of? Go on a letter hunt. Pick a letter and see how many objects you can find that begin with the letter. Build with Legos, blocks, or empty containers. Play with play dough, color, paint, or cut paper. Sing and dance. Visit learning websites such as starfall.com, pbskids.org, and scholastic.com/learnathome. Also this: https://www.abcmouse.com/Redeem code: AOFLUNICEF

If any Pre-K students need any supplies or books to use during our time at home, please email Mrs. Lofland.

post_text:
FCCLA Projects:

Ryane and Lindy did a project focusing on children called Sweethearts. They used their personal experience of both having a sister that was being premature and made heart shaped blankets that are preemie sized that the mother could hold and have her scent on before it was distributed to the babies. Their board represents their ‚Äúwhy‚Äù (their sisters) .... the statistics of how important it is for the mothers scent to be close, and actual nicu babies at United regional using the blankets.

Windthorst ISD Staff Spotlight:

Maxine Veitenheimer

Maxine Veitenheimer is a Windthorst graduate of 1971. She and John Veitenheimer have been married for 48 years. They have 3 children Bradley, Stephanie, and Tracie all Windthorst graduates. She also has 2 grandsons Mitchell and Mason. Maxine likes to shop and attend her grandson's activities. She has also been a hospice volunteer for 19 years.

post_text: Jude, a WISD Kindergarten student, performed for his classmates by playing the violin. He played songs such as: "French Folk Song", "Song of the Wind", and "Grandma Rides a Motorcycle". He graciously let us sing along as he played, "Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star". Jude also let his friends pluck a string on the violin so they were involved in the performance. We are very impressed and proud of our little maestro!
text: Jude, a WISD Kindergarten student, performed for his classmates by playing the violin. He played songs such as: "French Folk Song", "Song of the Wind", and "Grandma Rides a Motorcycle". He graciously let us sing along as he played, "Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star". Jude also let his friends pluck a string on the violin so they were involved in the performance. We are very impressed and proud of our little maestro!

post_text:
Windthorst ISD Staff Spotlight:

Laurie Veitenheimer

Hi, my name is Laurie L. Veitenheimer and this is my 8th year as a culinary engineer (lunch lady) at Windthorst ISD.
I‚Äôm married to my high school sweetheart, Donald, and this year we will be celebrating 30 blessed years together. We are both graduates of WHS (‚Äò87 & ‚Äò89).
We have 3 children who are also graduates of good ole WHS.
Alexaundria (WHS ‚Äò10) graduated from MSU (‚Äò16) and is a teacher/coach at Jacksboro ISD. She is married to Dillon (WHS ‚Äò10). They live in Archer City.
Regan (WHS ‚Äò11) graduated from TCC and is in aviation maintenance. He is married to Sierra and they live near Krum.
Kennedy (WHS ‚Äò16) attended MSU and is currently employed by Lantek Communications. He resides in Ft. Worth.
When we are not working, my husband and I love traveling and spending time with family and friends.

post_text:
WINDTHORST FFA FISH FRY AND RAFFLE

The Windthorst Friends of FFA will be holding their annual Ash Wednesday Fish Fry on February 26, 2020 in the Windthorst High School Foyer. Fish and all the trimmings will be served from 5pm to 8pm. $12 for adults and $6 for 10 and under.

FFA students are also selling raffle tickets for either a fire pit with 10 steaks and seasonings or a fire pit with s‚Äômores and more along with a certificate good for Marker Cellars Family Winery Barrel Room tastings and appetizers for 8 people. Raffle tickets are $5 each or 5 tickets for $20.

Both fire pits were built by FFA members. Kendall Wolf and Gage McAnally have donated their Archer County Ag Mechanics champion fire pit back to the FFA to help benefit all FFA students.

Please see a Windthorst FFA student to purchase your raffle tickets. All proceeds go directly back to the FFA students to help with scholarships, convention costs and add on funds for FFA students who show at the county show.

Thank you for supporting the Windthorst FFA!

post_text:
Mr. Gatlin‚Äôs Geometry classes have been learning about Lateral area, Total area and Volume of Prisms and Pyramids. In conjunction with Ms. Baggett‚Äôs Sophomore English classes, the students were asked to prepare a professional letter to the current owners of US Lighthouses requesting information that was not readily available on the internet. Even though some students didn‚Äôt receive a response, they were still instructed to create a scale model of their chosen lighthouse and to display the information on a display board.
Come by Rm 114 in the high school wing to view these amazing results!

post_text:
A message from Mr. Hise:

Last week we missed two days because of bad weather. We will be required to make up one of those days because we are short of the 75600 minutes requirement for the students. There were two days we could have used to make these up, the day after Easter or the day at the end of the school year.

The District Improvement Team chose to make the day up at the end of the year. So, we will not be out for the summer until Thursday, May 21st at noon.

At this point going forward we will be required to make up any day or hour we miss. If we have a late start we will have to make it up. If we have to miss a day we will have to make 8 hours up.

‚û°Ô∏èPlease make note of this change in our 2019-2020 School Year Calendar. Our last day of school is now Thursday, May 21st with an early release at noon.‚¨ÖÔ∏è

Thank You!

At this point going forward we will be required to make up any day or hour we miss. If we have a late start we will have to make it up. If we have to miss a day we will have to make 8 hours up.

post_text:
üö®Bad Weather Closing Procedureüö®

The Superintendent will make the official decision concerning the closing of the district‚Äôs facilities or having a late start because of bad weather conditions. When it becomes necessary to open late, to release students early, or to cancel school, district officials will post a notice on the district‚Äôs Facebook page, initiate the parent/staff phone calls and notify the following radio and television stations:

KAUZ, TV Channel 6
KFDX, TV Channel 3
KLUR, 99.9 Radio

District personnel monitor the National Weather Service, TX Dot and Local Law Enforcement and drive roads to ensure our buses and parents have safe driving conditions. The Superintendent will notify students and staff as soon as possible when the decision is made.

WISD Staff Spotlight:

Chris & Darla Tackett

Chris and Darla Tackett moved to Wichita Falls in July of 1997. Chris started teaching and coaching for Windthorst, while Darla coached and taught in Electra. They moved to Windthorst in October of 1998. Darla joined the staff at Windthorst in 1999. They have 4 children. Brady graduated WHS in 2017, graduated from Cisco college in 2019, where he played baseball and is currently attending EMT/Paramedic training in Lubbock Texas. Natalie is a senior, Tara is a freshman, and Heidi is in 5th grade. They each have 20+ years in education and enjoy being a part of such a wonderful community and school system.

post_text: Mrs. Lindley's 4th grade science class is learning about soil and completed a fun edible soil activity. Next time you see one of them, ask how rock weathers down to help form soil and why humus is important for plants. They used chocolate and butterscotch chips for the bedrock layer, pudding for subsoil, and crushed oreos for topsoil. It was topped off with green coconut and gummy worms. Who knew soil could be so delicious?

Next time you see one of them, ask how rock weathers down to help form soil and why humus is important for plants. They used chocolate and butterscotch chips for the bedrock layer, pudding for subsoil, and crushed oreos for topsoil. It was topped off with green coconut and gummy worms. Who knew soil could be so delicious?

Windthorst ISD Staff Spotlight:

Melanie Beisch

My name is Melanie Beisch and I currently teach Chemistry, Physics, Anatomy and Physiology and Forensics. I also serve as the UIL coordinator and the NHS sponsor. This is my 10th year at Windthorst and my 30th year of teaching. I previously taught 20 years at Zundy Junior High. I graduated from MSU with my bachelor‚Äôs and master‚Äôs degree. Rusty and I have been married for 30 years and have 2 children Emily (‚Äô12) works for Colorado Parks and Wildlife and Alec (‚Äô16) works for WISD in the technology department. In my spare time I like to read, support the Trojans and Trojanettes, and travel.

Thank you to all of the students that participated in the Archer City UIL Invitational Meet on Saturday. Students competed against Rider, Holliday, Archer, Olney, Iowa Park and City View. This was the first meet for our Academic UIL students. Awards were given to the top 6 places. Congratulations to the following students for placing in their events:
Current Events: Ferrin Garrett 3rd, Caleb Schroeder 7th, 3rd place Team (Ferrin, Caleb, Brenae Hoff and Cade Hoffman)
Literary Criticism: Tagn Doyal 3rd place
Science: Madelyn Anderle 8th place Overall 4th place Team (Madelyn Anderle, Kaiden DiMarzio, Jayden Friddle, Gage Lindley)
Social Studies: Tagan Doyal 8th place
Spelling: Sydney Herndon 9th place 3rd place Team (Sydney Herndon, Laiken Farr, Millie Armendarez, Brynlee Wolf and Conner Schroeder)
Headline Writing: Brenna Anderle 4th place

Congratulations to these students!

WISD Staff Spotlight:

Dena Wolf

Hello, my name is Dena Wolf and I am currently the 3rd grade Reading/ELA teacher. This school year started my 11th year as a teacher. I am a 2003 graduate of Archer City High School. Which is where my career began as the varsity softball coach immediately after graduating from MSU in December of 2008. I coached for 2 years along with teaching kindergarten. I taught k-2 and 5th/6th grade while in Archer City. This is my 3rd year at Windthorst. I married my best friend, Brad Wolf, and we have been married for 10 years. Our precious daughter, Riley, was born in June of 2011. She is truly a blessing from God! In our spare time we are usually running her to games and practices and we wouldn't trade it for anything. I feel so blessed to be a part of Windthorst ISD.

post_text: The Band Boosters and I would like to thank everyone who helped out with our annual cheese sale. Whether it be purchasing a box, helping with packaging or delivering we truly appreciate everyone! We had some technical issues this year with the packaging of our Smoked Trio Box. If you would like to purchase any of the extra cheese, please respond in the comments section below (this will help us keep track of all of the requests!) THANK YOU for your continued support of the Windthorst Band Program!

shared_text:
Windthorst Independent School District added a new photo.
December 16, 2019 at 9:00 AM ¬∑

WISD Staff Spotlight:

Roy Longcrier

I consider my position in Windthorst as one of my greatest blessings. The stars were aligned just right for me to show up at Notre Dame high school 23 years ago. The principal at the time, desperately needed someone to teach computer applications. Three days later that person was me. Then serendipity once again prevailed when Howard Neeb did my evaluation for Notre Dame. Windthorst offered me a job as a computer teacher that fall. When I finished my administration degree, my beautiful new bride and I headed south. We stayed there for a decade, until Mr. Hise decided to part ways with the principal's office. As luck would have it, we were wanting a new opportunity. My wife and I are very happy to be back in this area. I am especially so, as I am convinced that providence, not luck, the stars, or serendipity, guided me to return home to Windthorst.

WISD Staff Spotlight:

Karen Berend

Hello, I am Karen Berend and this school year starts my 7th year at WISD. I graduated from Archer City in 1990 and attended Vernon College. I am in the elementary RTI math department. I have been married to Rodney Berend (WHS ‚Äô86) for 28 years and we have 3 daughters: Mikayla , and twins Blakeley and Blair. Mikayla (WHS ‚Äô12 and MSU '15) and husband Riley Schreiber(WHS ‚Äô11) are the parents to our first grandson, Milo Jax. Blakeley (WHS ‚Äô16) is attending MSU pursuing an Exercise Physiology degree and will graduate May 2020. Blair (WHS ‚Äò16) is also attending MSU pursuing a Marketing degree and will graduate May 2020. Blair and her fianc√©, Trace, will be married May 2020. When I am not at school, you can find me helping my husband daily at our dairy and I still work at my hair salon that I have owned since 1994. I truly enjoy being a part of WISD.

post_text: The Family Life & Mission Outreach Committee would like to sincerely thank the Windthorst ISD students and their parents for the very generous food contributions. The challange was put forth by the National Honor Society and sponsor Melanie Beisch and over 3,400 non-parishable items were donated. That along with the Thanksgiving collection in Church has filled our food pantry. This will help to feed many for several months in and around our community. We appreciate your giving spirit and awesome generosity. Thank you very much and may you never go hungry!

The challange was put forth by the National Honor Society and sponsor Melanie Beisch and over 3,400 non-parishable items were donated. That along with the Thanksgiving collection in Church has filled our food pantry. This will help to feed many for several months in and around our community. We appreciate your giving spirit and awesome generosity. Thank you very much and may you never go hungry!

Hello! Meet Scotty and Kim Lofland. He‚Äôs been a high school coach and has been teaching 4th/5th grades in Windthorst since 2006, and she‚Äôs been teaching Pre-K and first grade since 2009. He graduated high school in Holliday, and she graduated from Rider in Wichita Falls. They both graduated from MSU. They‚Äôve been married for 22 years and have 2 boys, Tim and Ben. Tim graduated from Windthorst in 2018, and Ben will be a 2021 graduate. In their spare time, he likes to drag her birdwatching, and she likes to drag him into house renovations.

Windthorst Independent School District added a new photo.
November 25, 2019 at 9:25 AM ¬∑

WISD Spotlight:

Sharla Anderson

Hey, my name is Sharla Anderson and this is my 7th year teaching at Windthorst ISD. I graduated from Windthorst ISD in 2002 and from Midwestern State University in 2007. I am the Family and Consumer Science Teacher, FCCLA adviser, and One Act Play director. I have three children that all attend school here as well. Saige is 13 (8th grade) and keeps us busy with Volleyball, Band, and Cheer, Daxton is 12 (6th grade) and loves playing Top of Texas football, and Dossen is 6 (Kindergarten) and enjoys eating cheeseburgers and being drug around to all his siblings' events. I enjoy spending time with my boyfriend Mike, watching, supporting, and cheering for my babies, and socializing with family and friends any chance I get. I look forward to many more years with Windthorst ISD.

Windthorst ISD Staff Spotlight:

Leann Hoff

Hello I am Leann Berend Hoff and I married Tom Hoff in November of 81
after we both graduated from WIndthorst High School in 1980!
We have 3 successful children that graduated from WIndthorst High school as well , Aaron Hoff, Miranda Hoff Rice and Emily Hoff Grotelueschen and have all went on to further their education and graduated from Texas A&M and Midwestern State University and their spouses as well have graduated from A&M!
We have one granddaughter, Ellie Grotelueschen and four grandsons, Wyatt Grotelueschen, Matthew Bexar Rice, Colton Grotelueschen and Baby Grotelueschen due the end of December. We love traveling and doing things with our grand kids! Did not know life with grandkids would be so GREAT ‚ô•Ô∏è
I work in the Windthorst ISD school cafeteria. I enjoy my job and I enjoy seeing the students everyday

Windthorst Independent School District added a new photo.
November 14, 2019 at 10:00 AM ¬∑

WISD Staff Spotlight:

Travis Vaughn

Hello, my name is Travis Vaughn and I am the Agriculture Science Teacher. This is my 23rd year in education, and my 13th year at Windthorst. I received my Bachelors of Science in Agriculture Economics from Texas A&M University Commerce, and completed my agriculture teaching certification from Tarleton State University. Before becoming a teacher I worked on the crab boats in Alaska & was the dairy herdsman for Willie Hoff‚Äôs dairy. My wife Juhree and I have three kids who graduated from Windthorst ISD. Our oldest, Kayci is a innovation specialist for Burkburnett ISD, Kayla is respiratory therapist at Comanche County Hospital & Trevor is a wean calf specialist for Transova Genetics. We also have a granddaughter, Hatleigh.
I enjoy traveling and have recently started learning more about viniculture and I am the vineyard manager for Marker Cellars.

Travis Vaughn

Hello, my name is Travis Vaughn and I am the Agriculture Science Teacher. This is my 23rd year in education, and my 13th year at Windthorst. I received my Bachelors of Science in Agriculture Economics from Texas A&M University Commerce, and completed my agriculture teaching certification from Tarleton State University. Before becoming a teacher I worked on the crab boats in Alaska & was the dairy herdsman for Willie Hoff‚Äôs dairy. My wife Juhree and I have three kids who graduated from Windthorst ISD. Our oldest, Kayci is a innovation specialist for Burkburnett ISD, Kayla is respiratory therapist at Comanche County Hospital & Trevor is a wean calf specialist for Transova Genetics. We also have a granddaughter, Hatleigh.
I enjoy traveling and have recently started learning more about viniculture and I am the vineyard manager for Marker Cellars.

post_text:
Remember! The National Honor Society is sponsoring a Canned Food Drive Contest November 4th-22nd. Each elementary teacher has a box. In junior high Coach Bussey-6th grade, Mrs. Stallcup-7th, and Coach Deatherage-8th will have a collection box. In high school, Coach Cole-9th, Mrs. Wolf-10th, Mrs. Haverland-11th, and Mrs. Beisch-12th will have a collection box. We are collecting canned goods/non-perishable items to support St. Mary's Family Mission and Life Outreach Food Pantry. We will run competitions between the grades and provide popcorn and ice cream floats to each winning class.

The Family Mission Pantry is currently providing food for an average of 40 families in the Windthorst area. Please encourage kids to donate, but realize that some of them may be on the receiving end of the donations.
text:
Remember! The National Honor Society is sponsoring a Canned Food Drive Contest November 4th-22nd. Each elementary teacher has a box. In junior high Coach Bussey-6th grade, Mrs. Stallcup-7th, and Coach Deatherage-8th will have a collection box. In high school, Coach Cole-9th, Mrs. Wolf-10th, Mrs. Haverland-11th, and Mrs. Beisch-12th will have a collection box. We are collecting canned goods/non-perishable items to support St. Mary's Family Mission and Life Outreach Food Pantry. We will run competitions between the grades and provide popcorn and ice cream floats to each winning class.

The Family Mission Pantry is currently providing food for an average of 40 families in the Windthorst area. Please encourage kids to donate, but realize that some of them may be on the receiving end of the donations.

Windthorst Independent School District added a new photo.
November 7, 2019 at 11:00 AM ¬∑

Windthorst ISD Staff Spotlight:

Lavern Lindemann

Hello, I am Lavern Lindemann. I am starting my 30th year at WISD. In 1990, I began work as a kindergarten aide, helped with the Big Blue Band for 11 years, as well as serving the students with reading interventions. My husband, Wayne, and I are WHS graduates (1973) as well as all three of our children. Melanie (1994) owns Wolf Insurance Agency, Karen (1998) is employed at Region 9 ESC with the Head Start Program, and Matt (2001) owns Windthorst Tire. We have 6 grandchildren that keep us busy with all their activities and events. I enjoy traveling, spending time with my family, and relaxing at the lake. WISD is a great place to work, and my coworkers are my second family.

Windthorst I.S.D. is accepting applications for a full-time school custodian.

Duties will include light lifting, building maintenance and some outside work.

Must pass background check/fingerprinting, employment physical and drug testing.

Pay is $10 per hour.

Contact Dennis Koetter at 940-237-2928 for more information.

Windthorst ISD Staff Spotlight:

Stacy Schroeder

2019-2020 starts my 19th year at the best job ever. - I am the High School / Junior High Secretary and I also run the Library for Pre-K thru 12th Grade. Bob and I have been married for 37 years, and have 3 great kids + our bonus kids - Chance (Son) & Ashley, Kenda (Daughter) & Justin, Rusty (Son) & Candi - who have blessed us with 6 amazing grandkids Kastin, Libby, Johnston, London , Raylynn and 1 little angel, Chase, watching over us!! My favorite things to do is to go to my grandkids activities, babysit them and work in my yard !!
